name: Scholar's Insight
desc: When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice: Arcana, History, Nature, or Religion.
Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of these skills.

name: Channel Divinity: Knowledge of the Ages
desc: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to tap into divine knowledge.
As an action, you choose one skill or tool. For 10 minutes, you have proficiency with the chosen skill or tool.

name: Mental Fortress
desc: Beginning at 6th level, your mind becomes fortified against intrusion. You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

Additionally, when you or a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see fails an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, you can use your reaction to allow that creature to reroll the save. The creature must use the new roll.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Potent Spellcasting
desc: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

name: Master of Lore
desc: At 17th level, your knowledge becomes nearly limitless. You can cast legend lore once without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.
Additionally, when you make an Intelligence check, you can replace the number you roll with a 15.

name: Bonus Cantrip
desc: When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain the light cantrip if you don't already know it.

name: Radiant Aura
desc: Also at 1st level, you can emanate an aura of bright light. As a bonus action, you can cause bright light to radiate from you in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet.
This light is sunlight. You can dismiss this light as a bonus action.
While this light is active, you and friendly creatures within the bright light have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

name: Channel Divinity: Radiant Burst
desc: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to release a burst of radiant energy.

As an action, you present your holy symbol and each hostile creature within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes radiant damage equal to 2d10 + your cleric level on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one.
A creature that has total cover from you is not affected.

name: Radiant Defense
desc: Starting at 6th level, you have resistance to radiant damage.
Additionally, when a creature within 30 feet of you takes radiant damage, you can use your reaction to grant that creature resistance to that instance of radiant damage.

name: Divine Strike
desc: At 8th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with radiant energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 radiant damage to the target.
When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

name: Corona of Light
desc: At 17th level, you can use your action to activate an aura of brilliant light that lasts for 1 minute or until you dismiss it using another action.
You emit bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light 30 feet beyond that. Your enemies in the bright light have disadvantage on saving throws against any spell that deals radiant or fire damage.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

name: Acolyte of Nature
desc: When you choose this domain at 1st level, you learn one druid cantrip of your choice. You also gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Animal Handling, Nature, or Survival.

name: Bonus Proficiency
desc: Also at 1st level, you gain proficiency with heavy armor.

name: Channel Divinity: Charm Animals and Plants
desc: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to charm animals and plants.

As an action, you present your holy symbol and invoke the name of your deity. Each beast or plant creature that can see you within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is charmed by you for 1 minute or until it takes damage.
While it is charmed by you, it is friendly to you and other creatures you designate.

name: Dampen Elements
desc: Starting at 6th level, when you or a creature within 30 feet of you takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, you can use your reaction to grant resistance to the creature against that instance of damage.

name: Divine Strike
desc: At 8th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 cold, fire, or lightning damage (your choice) to the target.
When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

name: Master of the Wild
desc: At 17th level, you gain the ability to command animals and plant creatures. While creatures are charmed by your Charm Animals and Plants feature, you can take a bonus action on your turn to verbally command what each of those creatures will do on its next turn.

name: Bonus Proficiencies
desc: At 1st level, you gain proficiency with martial weapons and heavy armor.

name: Wrath of the Storm
desc: Also at 1st level, you can thunderously rebuke attackers. When a creature within 5 feet of you that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to cause the creature to make a Dexterity saving throw.
The creature takes 2d8 lightning or thunder damage (your choice) on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Channel Divinity: Destructive Wrath
desc: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to wield the power of the storm with unchecked ferocity.
When you roll lightning or thunder damage, you can use your Channel Divinity to deal maximum damage, instead of rolling.

name: Thunderbolt Strike
desc: At 6th level, when you deal lightning damage to a Large or smaller creature, you can also push it up to 10 feet away from you.

name: Divine Strike
desc: At 8th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 thunder damage to the target.
When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

name: Stormborn
desc: At 17th level, you have a flying speed equal to your current walking speed whenever you are not underground or indoors.

name: Bonus Proficiencies
desc: When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain proficiency in Stealth and one of the following skills of your choice: Deception or Sleight of Hand.

name: Blessing of the Shadowfell
desc: Also at 1st level, you gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, its range increases by 30 feet.
Additionally, you can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by dim light or darkness.

name: Channel Divinity: Cloak of Shadows
desc: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to vanish into shadows.
As an action, you become invisible until the end of your next turn. You become visible if you attack or cast a spell.

name: Shadow Step
desc: At 6th level, you gain the ability to step from one shadow into another. When you are in dim light or darkness, as a bonus action you can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in dim light or darkness.
You have advantage on the first melee attack you make before the end of the turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Potent Spellcasting
desc: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

name: Master of Shadows
desc: At 17th level, you can use an action to activate a shadowy aura that lasts for 1 minute or until you dismiss it using another action.

While the aura is active, attacks against you have disadvantage, and when a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see attacks you, you can use your reaction to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

name: Bonus Proficiencies
desc: When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain proficiency with heavy armor and martial weapons.

name: Eye of the Doomsayer
desc: Also at 1st level, you can mark a creature for doom. As a bonus action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. That creature is marked until the start of your next turn.
The next attack roll made against the marked creature by an ally of yours has advantage, and if that attack hits, it deals an extra 1d6 damage.

name: Channel Divinity: Pronounce Doom
desc: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to pronounce divine judgment upon your foes.

As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak words of doom. Choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws for 1 minute.
At the end of each of its turns, the creature can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the effect ends.

name: Inevitable Fate
desc: Starting at 6th level, when you or an ally you can see within 30 feet makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw with disadvantage, you can use your reaction to remove the disadvantage for that roll.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Divine Strike
desc: At 8th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with the weight of destiny. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 psychic damage to the target.
When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

name: Avatar of Doom
desc: At 17th level, you can use an action to become an avatar of inevitable fate for 1 minute.

While in this form, you have resistance to all damage, and once per turn when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is stunned until the end of your next turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

name: Orbital Attunement
desc: Starting at 2nd level when you choose this circle, you learn to draw power from celestial movements. You can use your Wild Shape to transform into celestial energy instead of beast form.
As a bonus action, you can expend a use of Wild Shape to enter an Orbital Form for 1 hour. While in this form:
- You gain a flying speed of 30 feet.
- You can use a bonus action to teleport up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
- Once per turn when you deal damage to a creature, you can deal an extra 1d6 force damage.
You can revert to your normal form using a bonus action. You automatically revert if you fall unconscious, drop to 0 hit points, or die.

name: Gravitational Pull
desc: At 6th level, you can manipulate gravitational forces. As an action, choose a point you can see within 60 feet of you. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be pulled 10 feet toward the center.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Celestial Body
desc: At 10th level, while in your Orbital Form, you gain resistance to force damage and your teleport distance increases to 30 feet.
Additionally, the extra force damage from your Orbital Form increases to 1d8.

name: Cosmic Rebirth
desc: At 14th level, when you are reduced to 0 hit points while in Orbital Form, you can use your reaction to drop to 1 hit point instead and immediately teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You then emit a burst of stellar energy, and each creature within 10 feet of your starting location must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking 4d10 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

name: Mystic Training
desc: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain the ability to channel mystical energy. You learn two cantrips of your choice from the wizard spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these cantrips.

Additionally, you can use a bonus action to enter a Mystic State for 1 minute. While in this state, you have advantage on concentration checks to maintain spells, and your weapon attacks deal an extra 1d4 psychic damage.
You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Telekinetic Strike
desc: Starting at 7th level, when you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with a telekinetic assault. Choose a creature you can see within 30 feet. The target must make a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 force damage and is pushed up to 10 feet in a direction of your choice. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't pushed.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

name: Mental Barrier
desc: At 10th level, you can create a barrier of pure mental force. As a reaction when you or a creature within 10 feet of you is hit by an attack, you can create a barrier that grants a +5 bonus to AC against that attack, potentially causing it to miss.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

name: Enhanced Mystic State
desc: Starting at 15th level, while in your Mystic State, the extra psychic damage from your weapon attacks increases to 1d8, and you have resistance to psychic damage.
Additionally, your Telekinetic Strike damage increases to 3d8.

name: Mystic Ascension
desc: At 18th level, when you use your Action Surge, you can enter a heightened Mystic State for 1 minute without expending a use. While in this heightened state, you gain all the benefits of your Mystic State, and additionally:
- You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

- Once per turn when you hit with a weapon attack, you can force the target to make an Intelligence saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier) or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

name: Spirit Communion
desc: Starting when you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you can commune with nature spirits. You learn the druidcraft cantrip and can speak with animals at will, without expending a spell slot.
Additionally, when you finish a short or long rest in a natural outdoor environment, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier + your monk level.

name: Primal Aspect
desc: Also at 3rd level, you can channel primal spirits into your strikes. When you hit a creature with one of the attacks granted by your Flurry of Blows, you can spend 1 ki point to choose one of the following effects:
- Bear: The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
- Wolf: The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the end of your next turn.
- Eagle: The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or you can immediately move up to 15 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

name: Spirit Defense
desc: At 6th level, primal spirits guard you from harm. When you take damage from a creature you can see, you can use your reaction to gain resistance to that damage.
Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and you have resistance to poison damage.

name: Spirit Walker
desc: At 11th level, you can become temporarily intangible like a spirit. You can cast gaseous form on yourself without requiring material components. When you cast the spell in this way, its duration is 10 minutes.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you spend 4 ki points to use it again.

name: Guardian Spirits
desc: At 17th level, you can summon primal spirits to protect you and your allies. As an action, you can spend 6 ki points to summon spiritual guardians in a 30-foot radius around you for 1 minute.

When a creature starts its turn in this area, you can choose to heal it for 3d8 hit points or deal 3d8 radiant damage to it (no action required). Each creature can be affected in this way only once per turn.

name: Channel Divinity: Nature's Wrath
desc: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following Channel Divinity option.

You can use your Channel Divinity to invoke the primal forces of nature. As an action, you can cause spectral vines to spring up and reach for a creature within 10 feet of you that you can see. The creature must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (its choice) or be restrained for 1 minute.

While restrained, the creature takes 1d6 piercing damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Channel Divinity: Healing Growth
desc: As an action, you can channel verdant energy to heal wounds. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you regains hit points equal to 1d6 + your Charisma modifier.
Plants within 30 feet of you grow visibly during this effect, and the area becomes lush and vibrant for 1 hour.

name: Aura of Renewal
desc: Starting at 7th level, you and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you have resistance to poison and necrotic damage.

Additionally, at the start of each of your turns, you and each friendly creature within the aura regain hit points equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) if you have less than half your hit points remaining.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

name: Verdant Resilience
desc: At 15th level, when you are reduced to 0 hit points and are not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
Additionally, you have advantage on death saving throws.

name: Champion of Growth
desc: At 20th level, you can assume the form of a champion of nature, taking on an appearance you choose. For example, vines might wrap around your armor, flowers bloom in your wake, or your eyes might glow with verdant energy.
Using your action, you undergo a transformation. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:
- At the start of each of your turns, you regain 10 hit points.
- Whenever you cast a paladin spell that restores hit points, you restore the maximum number of hit points possible.
- Friendly creatures within 30 feet of you have advantage on death saving throws.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

name: Assassination Training
desc: Starting at 3rd level, you are at your deadliest when you get the drop on your enemies. You have advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn in the combat yet.
In addition, any hit you score against a creature that is surprised is a critical hit.

name: Infiltration Expertise
desc: Also at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with the disguise kit and poisoner's kit.
Additionally, you can unfailingly create false identities for yourself. You must spend seven days and 25 gp to establish the history, profession, and affiliations for an identity.

You can't establish an identity that belongs to someone else. Thereafter, if you adopt the new identity as a disguise, other creatures believe you to be that person until given an obvious reason not to.

name: Strike from Shadows
desc: At 9th level, you can hide as a bonus action when you are in dim light or darkness.

Additionally, if you are hidden from a creature when you cast a spell or make an attack roll against it, it doesn't automatically reveal your position. Make a Dexterity (Stealth) check against the creature's passive Perception. On a success, you remain hidden.

name: Deadly Precision
desc: Starting at 13th level, when you score a critical hit with an attack roll, you can add your Dexterity modifier to the damage roll.

name: Death Strike
desc: At 17th level, you become a master of instant death. When you attack and hit a creature that is surprised, it must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, double the damage of your attack against the creature.

name: Magic Siphon
desc: Starting at 3rd level, when you deal Sneak Attack damage to a creature, you can choose to siphon magical energy instead of dealing your Sneak Attack damage.

The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier) or have one spell of your choice of 3rd level or lower that it currently has active end immediately.
If you successfully end a spell in this way, you gain temporary hit points equal to 5 times the spell's level (minimum of 5).
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

name: Arcane Resistance
desc: Also at 3rd level, you have advantage on saving throws against spells, and you have resistance to damage from spells.

name: Redirect Magic
desc: At 9th level, when you succeed on a saving throw against a spell that targets only you, you can use your reaction to reflect the spell back at the caster. The spell targets the caster using the same attack roll or saving throw DC.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

name: Improved Magic Siphon
desc: At 13th level, your Magic Siphon can affect spells of 5th level or lower, and you can use it twice before needing to finish a short or long rest.

Additionally, when you successfully end a spell with Magic Siphon, you learn what spell was active and can cast it once within the next hour without needing components. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

name: Arcane Absorption
desc: At 17th level, when a creature within 30 feet of you casts a spell, you can use your reaction to attempt to steal it. Make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level.

On a success, the spell fails and has no effect, and you can cast that spell once within the next 10 minutes without requiring components or a spell slot. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.
Once you successfully use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
